newsitem.title: UK: MAM names five to retirement trust board.
newsitem.headline: MAM names five to retirement trust board.

text.p: Mercury Asset Management said on Thursday it has appointed five members to the board of Mercury Retirement Trust, its new retail retirement product.
Michael Mason, deputy chairman of Charterhouse Tilney Securities, will be chairman.

Directors are Carol Galley, vice chairman of MAM; Donald Macpherson, chairman of NatWest Markets Corporate Finance; John Martin, formerly investment director of British Steel Pension Fund; and Steven Zimmerman, deputy chairman of MAM.

MAM has recently moved to integrate its retail operations with its core institutional business. Analysts have said that MAM must tap the growing retail pension market, and grow its institutional business if it is to maintain its strong industry position.
Mercury Retirement Trust is expected to launch in early June and aims to raise between 50 and 75 million sterling.
